author: thomasbruggink
body:
Currently the exception of Invoke-WebRequest does not contain the original response. A regex is used to remove the HTML tags to make it easier to read https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility/commands/utility/WebCmdlet/Common/WebRequestPSCmdlet.Common.cs#L1525.
The only way to get the response is by using `$_.ErrorDetails.Message` which is not the original message. Using `$_.Exception.Response.Content.ReadAsStringAsync().GetAwaiter().GetResult()` returns `"The stream was already consumed. It cannot be read again."` because the stream is disposed on line 1535.

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
try {
 # Endpoint that returns an html error
 Invoke-WebRequest "http://localhost"
}
catch {
 # Does not contain the HTML tags
 Write-Verbose $_.ErrorDetails.Message -Verbose
}
```

# Expected behavior

```none
A property or method that returns the original response
For example: $_.ErrorDetails.OriginalMessage
```

# Actual behavior

```none
The parsed and HTML tag stripped response
```
